required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of 1.5% Potassium Oxalate on the Control of Tooth Sensitivity and Color Change After Home Bleaching
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of 1.5% Potassium Oxalate on the Control of Tooth Sensitivity and Color Change After Home Bleaching: a Randomized, Placebo-controlled Clinical Study

brief_summary.textblock: This double-blind randomized clinical trial evaluated the effect of 1.5% potassium oxalate on pain sensitivity control and color change after home tooth whitening. It also evaluated the influence of potassium oxalate on health-related quality of life (HRQOL) and on the degree of patient satisfaction after bleaching treatment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 21 days after the start of the whitening treatment
primary_outcome.description: evaluation of dentinal sensitivity during treatment through a daily questionnaire, using a visual analogue scale with values from 0 to 10, with higher values indicating a worse level of pain.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 21 days and 1 month after the bleaching treatment
primary_outcome.description: Color evaluation was performed using the EasyshadeAdvanced spectrophotometer (Vita-Zahnfabrik, GE, Germany), using the CIE L*a*b* system.

arm_group.description: Home bleaching treatment (Carbamide Peroxide (PC) 22%) + placebo gel
Home bleaching treatment (Carbamide Peroxide (PC) 22%) + 1.5% Potassium Oxalate gel

intervention.description: Application of one drop of Polanight bleaching agent (SDI, SP, Brazil) on each corresponding tooth in a tray that was used for 45 minutes a day, for a period of twenty-one days. After the bleaching treatment, the participants were instructed to wash the trays under running water and dry them. The volunteers were instructed to apply a small amount of placebo gel, without active ingredient, with color, texture and odor similar to 1.5% oxalate gel (Painless, BM4, SC, Brazil) in the spaces related to the vestibular portions of the teeth trays, which were used for 10 minutes.

Application of one drop of Polanight bleaching agent (SDI, SP, Brazil) on each corresponding tooth in a tray that was used for 45 minutes a day, for a period of twenty-one days. After the bleaching treatment, the participants were instructed to wash the trays under running water and dry them with absorbent paper. The volunteers applied a small amount of 1.5% potassium oxalate gel (Painless, BM4, SC, Brazil) in the spaces relative to the vestibular portions of the tray's teeth, which were used for 10 minutes.
